alert.note: Alert for Western Siskiyou County (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued April 02 at 2:56PM PDT until April 03 at 11:00AM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM PDT MONDAY ABOVE 2500 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow above 2500 feet. Additional snow accumulations of 2 to 5 inches. * WHERE...Western Siskiyou County above 2500 feet west of the Scott Valley, including higher portions of Sawyers Bar Road. * WHEN...Until 11 AM PDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Additional light snowfall is expected Monday afternoon into Tuesday evening. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Travel is strongly discouraged because of dangerous conditions. * If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets, food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * A Winter Storm Warning means that severe winter weather is occurring and poses a threat to life and property. Take protective action now.
